title: DOCS: Remove boston dataset from the README
body:
## Overview

Closes https://github.com/dsgibbons/shap/issues/8 and resolves the issues noted in https://github.com/dsgibbons/shap/issues/8#issuecomment-1545567370

Related to #2322

Updating the README required the following additional changes:

- Return `pl.gcf()` when `show=False` for `bar`, `beeswarm` and `scatter`. I needed this to export the PNGs referenced in the README.
- Use relative paths for README images instead of URLs tied to master.
- Add `plt.rcParams['figure.constrained_layout.use'] = True` to `shap.plots.__init__.py` to prevent labels from being cutoff (before this change, the waterfall diagram has its y-axis labels cut off when changed from `boston` to `california`).
- HTML plots generated inside a notebook, rendered in Chrome, and then screenshotted. There is no obvious way to convert the HTML straight to an image, as it requires JS - unless @connortann or @thatlittleboy know of a better way to convert `shap` HTML to PNG? I've tried several different HTML to PNG converters, but I keep getting a `shap` error saying JS needs initialising.

## Checklist

- [x] All [pre-commit checks](https://pre-commit.com/#install) pass.
- [ ] Unit tests added (if fixing a bug or adding a new feature)
